basics.name: Joshua Kelly
basics.label: VP, Engineering
basics.summary: In 2011 I became the second developer at a VC-backed ecommerce startup in the 'sharing economy' space. That company was sold to Live Nation Entertainment in 2015, and I became Universe's Vice President, Engineering. If you've bought a ticket to a TechCrunch Disrupt recently, you've used us. I was its primary technical architect, and designed critical-path solutions for the company in key moments: from launching our first sale for Blizzard's Blizzcon (an infamously hard to scale event), to writing version one of our embedded checkout product - the essential reason for our later acquisiton. As a team of sixty today, we have a global presence with offices in San Francisco, Toronto, New York, and London. Independently of my leadership at Universe, I am a technologist at heart. Some of my original work in 2017 includes:  - Spring: A gallery installation in London, titled 'Corporeality'. Using images crawled from a large social media app, I trained a DCGAN to produce new instances of images to match the set. The end result was a haunting series of 'artifical' faces - ghost-like phantoms. - Summer: An Elixir-based interpreter for Urbit's Nock combinator VM as specified in their whitepaper (https://www.github.com/jdjkelly/martian  ) - Fall: A short-form decentralized messaging app built on Ethereum's contract event logs (https://www.github.com/jdjkelly/transponder)

work.summary: Universe is an international DIY platform for selling tickets. Our technology powers the ticket buying experience for some of the most passionate fans in the world (Blizzard Entertainment's annual Blizzcon) and some of tech's biggest events (TechCrunch Disrupt).
highlights: Acquired by Live Nation Entertainment in 2015 for an undisclosed amount
Member of original pre-acquisition team, second developer
Led team through scaling a platform transacting $x0M to $x00M in gross ticket sales

work.summary: Pre-acuqisition Universe, above, was initially a VC-backed startup (led by Real Ventures), raising $2.5M.
highlights: Architected and built version one of the core application, from $0 to $x0M in gross ticket sales
Launched Embed.js - a best-in-class distributed commerce ticket checkout
Participated in technical due diligence process with Ticketmaster CTO during LNE acquisition

references.name: Erlich Bachman
references.reference: It is my pleasure to recommend Richard, his performance working as a consultant for Main St. Company proved that he will be a valuable addition to any company.
